Class JxseTcpTransportConfiguration

java.lang.Object

                      net.jxse.configuration.JxseTcpTransportConfiguration
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Map<Object,Object>
public class JxseTcpTransportConfiguration
extends JxtaTransportConfiguration

Defines the TCP transport configuration when connecting to the JXTA network.

See Also:

setTcpPort

public void setTcpPort(int port)
Sets the TCP transport listening port or removes any existing configuration if parameter is lesser than 0 or greater then 65535.

Parameters:
port - the new tcpPort value

getTcpPort

public int getTcpPort()
Returns the TCP transport listening port or -1 if no existing configuration can be found.

Returns:
the TCP port value or -1.

setTcpStartPort

public void setTcpStartPort(int start)
Sets the lowest port on which the TCP Transport will listen if configured to do so. Valid values are -1, 0 and 1-65535.

The -1 value is used to signify that the port range feature should be disabled. The 0 specifies that the Socket API dynamic port allocation should be used. For values 1-65535 the value must be equal to or less than the value used for end port.

If the parameter is < 0 or > 65535, any existing configuration is removed.

Parameters:
start - the lowest port on which to listen.

getTcpStartPort

public int getTcpStartPort()
Return the TCP start port or -1 if no configuration is available.

Returns:
the TCP start port or -1.

setTcpEndPort

public void setTcpEndPort(int end)
Returns the highest port on which the TCP Transport will listen if configured to do so. Valid values are -1, 0 and 1-65535.

The -1 value is used to signify that the port range feature should be disabled. The 0 specifies that the Socket API dynamic port allocation should be used. For values 1-65535 the value must be equal to or greater than the value used for start port.

If the parameter is < 0 or > 65535, any existing configuration is removed.

Parameters:
end - the new TCP end port

getTcpEndPort

public int getTcpEndPort()
Return the TCP end port or -1 if no configuration is available.

Returns:
the TCP end port or -1.

setTcpIncoming

public void setTcpIncoming(boolean incoming)
Toggles TCP transport server (incoming) mode (default is on)

Parameters:
incoming - the new TCP server mode

getTcpIncoming

public boolean getTcpIncoming()
Returns the TCP transport server incoming mode (default is on)

Returns:
true if TCP communication is allowed, false otherwise

setTcpOutgoing

public void setTcpOutgoing(boolean outgoing)
Sets TCP transport server (outgoing) mode.

Parameters:
outgoing - the TCP server outgoing mode

getTcpOutgoing

public boolean getTcpOutgoing()
Returns the TCP transport server outgoing mode

Returns:
the new TCP server outgoing mode

setTcpInterfaceAddress

public void setTcpInterfaceAddress(String address)
Sets the TCP transport interface address, or removes any existing configuration if the parameter is null.

e.g. "192.168.1.1"

Parameters:
address - the TCP transport interface address

getTcpInterfaceAddress

public String getTcpInterfaceAddress()
Provides the TCP interface address or null if none is available.

Returns:
the TCP interface address configuration or null

setTcpPublicAddress

public void setTcpPublicAddress(String address,
                                Boolean exclusive)
Sets the node public address or removes any configuration if address is null.

e.g. "192.168.1.1:9701"

This address is the physical address defined in a node's AccessPointAdvertisement. This often required for NAT'd/FW nodes

Parameters:
address - the TCP transport public address
exclusive - public address advertised exclusively

getTcpPublicAddress

public String getTcpPublicAddress()
Provides the TCP public address or null if no configuration is available.

Returns:
the TCP public address

getTcpPublicAddressExclusivity

public Boolean getTcpPublicAddressExclusivity()
Indicates the TCP public address exclusivity or false if no configuration is available.

Returns:
the TCP public address
